doh! I had to add a default constructor to my extended class ...

--- In junit@y..., "pantinori" <pantinori@y...> wrote:
> I am loading up my list of test cases from an xml file with 
something 
> like class and method.  Then using class.forname and 
> class.newinstance I would instantiate the TestCase.  I then wanted 
to 
> call TestCase.setName and then add the testcase to the testsuite.  
> unfortunately the newInstance fails because TestCase has a default 
> constructor that is not public.  :(  Is there a particular reason 
why 
> this is so?   Thanks for help.
> 
> Paul Antinori
